recommendation_sets.guideline_name: EULAR recommendations for the management of ANCA-associated vasculitis: 2022 update

recommendations.action: biopsy to assist in establishing diagnosis
recommendations.source_text: A positive biopsy is strongly supportive of a diagnosis of vasculitis and we recommend biopsies to assist in establishing a new diagnosis of AAV and for further evaluation of patients suspected of having relapsing vasculitis.

recommendations.population: patients with signs/symptoms suspicious for AAV
recommendations.action: test for both PR3-ANCA and MPO-ANCA using high-quality antigen-specific assay
recommendations.source_text: In patients with signs and/or symptoms raising suspicion of a diagnosis of AAV, we recommend testing for both PR3-ANCA and MPO-ANCA using a high-quality antigen-specific assay as the primary method of testing.

recommendations.population: patients with new-onset or relapsing GPA or MPA
recommendations.action: combination of glucocorticoids and either rituximab or cyclophosphamide
recommendations.source_text: For induction of remission in patients with new-onset or relapsing GPA or MPA with organ-threatening or life-threatening disease, we recommend treatment with a combination of glucocorticoids and either rituximab or cyclophosphamide. Rituximab is preferred in relapsing disease.

For induction of remission of non-organ-threatening or non-life-threatening GPA or MPA, treatment with a combination of glucocorticoids and rituximab is recommended. Methotrexate or mycophenolate mofetil can be considered as alternatives to rituximab.

recommendations.population: patients with GPA or MPA receiving induction therapy
recommendations.action: oral glucocorticoids starting dose 50-75 mg prednisolone equivalent/day
recommendations.preferred: 50-75 mg prednisolone equivalent/day depending on body weight
recommendations.taper_target: 5 mg prednisolone equivalent per day by 4-5 months
recommendations.source_text: As part of regimens for induction of remission in GPA or MPA, we recommend treatment with oral glucocorticoids at a starting dose of 50-75 mg prednisolone equivalent/day, depending on body weight. We recommend stepwise reduction in glucocorticoids according to table 4 and achieving a dose of 5 mg prednisolone equivalent per day by 4-5 months.

recommendations.action: avacopan in combination with rituximab or cyclophosphamide may be considered
recommendations.source_text: Avacopan in combination with rituximab or cyclophosphamide may be considered for induction of remission in GPA or MPA, as part of a strategy to substantially reduce exposure to glucocorticoids.

recommendations.severity: serum creatinine >300 µmol/L due to active glomerulonephritis
recommendations.action: plasma exchange may be considered; routine use for alveolar haemorrhage not recommended
recommendations.source_text: Plasma exchange may be considered as part of therapy to induce remission in GPA or MPA for those with a serum creatinine >300 pmol/L due to active glomerulonephritis. Routine use of plasma exchange to treat alveolar haemorrhage in GPA and MPA is not recommended.

recommendations.population: patients with GPA or MPA with refractory disease
recommendations.action: thorough reassessment of disease status and comorbidities
recommendations.source_text: For patients with GPA or MPA with disease refractory to therapy to induce remission, we recommend a thorough reassessment of disease status and comorbidities and consideration of options for additional or different treatment. These patients should be managed in close conjunction with, or referred to, a centre with expertise in vasculitis.

For maintenance of remission of GPA and MPA, after induction of remission with either rituximab or cyclophosphamide, we recommend treatment with rituximab. Azathioprine or methotrexate may be considered as alternatives.

We recommend that therapy to maintain remission for GPA and MPA be continued for 24—48 months following induction of remission of new-onset disease. Longer duration of therapy should be considered in relapsing patients or those with an increased risk of relapse, but should be balanced against patient preferences and risks of continuing immunosuppression.

recommendations.population: patients with new-onset or relapsing EGPA
recommendations.action: combination of high-dose glucocorticoids and cyclophosphamide
recommendations.source_text: For induction of remission in new-onset or relapsing EGPA with organ-threatening or life-threatening manifestations, we recommend treatment with a combination of high-dose glucocorticoids and cyclophosphamide. A combination of high-dose glucocorticoids and rituximab may be considered as an alternative.

recommendations.population: patients with new-onset or relapsing EGPA
recommendations.source_text: For induction of remission in new-onset or relapsing EGPA without organ-threatening or life-threatening manifestations, we recommend treatment with glucocorticoids.

recommendations.population: patients with relapsing or refractory EGPA
recommendations.severity: without active organ-threatening or life-threatening disease
recommendations.source_text: For induction of remission in patients with relapsing or refractory EGPA without active organ-threatening or life-threatening disease, we recommend the use of mepolizumab.

recommendations.condition: maintenance of remission after organ-threatening or life-threatening disease
recommendations.action: treatment with methotrexate, azathioprine, mepolizumab or rituximab should be considered
recommendations.source_text: For maintenance of remission of EGPA after induction of remission for organ-threatening or life-threatening disease, treatment with either methotrexate, azathioprine, mepolizumab or rituximab should be considered.

recommendations.condition: maintenance of remission after non-organ-threatening manifestations
recommendations.severity: non-organ-threatening or life-threatening manifestations at relapse
recommendations.source_text: For maintenance of remission of relapsing EGPA after induction of remission for non-organ-threatening or life-threatening manifestations at the time of relapse, we recommend treatment with mepolizumab.

recommendations.action: measurement of serum immunoglobulin concentrations prior to each course
recommendations.source_text: In patients with AAV receiving rituximab, we recommend measurement of serum immunoglobulin concentrations prior to each course of rituximab to detect secondary immunodeficiency.

recommendations.population: patients with AAV receiving immunosuppressive therapy
recommendations.condition: receiving rituximab, cyclophosphamide and/or high-dose glucocorticoids
recommendations.action: use of trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole prophylaxis against Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia
recommendations.source_text: For patients with AAV receiving rituximab, cyclophosphamide and/or high doses of glucocorticoids, we recommend the use of trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole as prophylaxis against Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia and other infections.
